channel.title: netbook
channel.description:
Hello all, I will study in about 2 months and need a netbook for that. I want to buy one which has something better than an intel gma gpu, so I can play at least some games. So does anybody of you have a suggestion which one I should buy?
Thanks in advance!

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
well, I like not seeing every pixel at the first glance, so yeah matter of taste.

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: DS4H
item.description:
Text was just an example, not all things are pleasantly and conveniently scalable on screen. It’s a matter of taste in the end, and that was just my two cents, no need to get smart over this.

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
ever heard of font size?

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: DS4H
item.description:
Nice choice, except I would think twice before choosing that resolution on a 15 inch screen. Well, matter of taste I guess, but my eyes would bleed out from bloody small pixels while, say, reading a lengthy paper.

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
well, I was looking for some other notebooks with similar specs and the price was about the same.
Anyway, I decided to buy a NB with better specs from this Company, so I composed this one(based on XMG A501):

  • 15,6" 1920x1080 Display
  • NVIDIA GT 555M (2GB ded. VRAM) /w OPTIMUS
  • Intel Core-i5-2410M(2.3GHz - 2.9GHz)
  • 4GB DDR3-1333 RAM
  • 500GB SATA2 Seagate Momentus(7200RPM)
  • THX TruStudio Pro Soundsystem
  • Fingerprint scanner
  • Intel Centrino Advanced-N 6230

Pics(different specs)
Price: 853,00€

The price is way over my initial price boundary because I pay this thing monthly(about 27€/month).

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Solid notebook, although the pricing seems a little over the top for me, but then again I’m not sure what the prices are like where you live. Enjoy!

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
Thanks for all the suggestions.
I think I’m going to buy a custom Notebook from Schenker with these specs:
Name: M4S XMG A521 ADVANCED GAMING Notebook 39,6cm (15,6")
• NVIDIA GeForce GT 540M 1024MB GDDR3(/W NVidia Optimus)
• Intel Core i3-2310M - 2,10 GHz 3MB
• 4GB ( 2x2048 ) SO-DIMM DDR3 RAM 1333MHz
• 320GB SATA-II 7200U/Min Seagate Momentus 7200.4 (ST9320423AS)
• DVD drive
• Intel Centrino Wireless-N 1030 (incl. Bluetooth)

Price: 679€

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
You’ll have trouble running TF2 on medium on that HP. I have a Dell laptop with an 8400gs (more powerful than the ION in the HP) and it struggled with tf2 on medium settings at 1366x768 (common netbook res) during heavy fights.

I’d suggest a small 14.1" laptop with some sort of dedicated graphics, like nvidia’s optimus switchable graphics. That’ll give you good battery life, portability, and some gaming ability.

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
I feel like these things can only run quasi-beefish games because of undoubtedly microscopic native resolutions

Read full topic

So yeah, the Notebook/Sub-Notebook should be able to run at least tf2 on medium.

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: calhoun_freeman
item.description:
Portable gaming is for pussies. Real men carry around 20 pound desktops.

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Yeah, but the question was which netbook could handle gaming, and I’m sorry but hiding by benchmarks, that HP would be unable to run BMS in anything but 800x600

If you want portable gaming, I suggest you wait for the NGP. it’s dropping later this year and is a much cheaper and smaller option than shelling out a lot of money on alienware’s piece of crap m11x (which I maintain is the only netbook even remotely capable of gaming)

Read full topic

item.description:
tiny + cheap

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
The ION in that netbook is considerably less powerful than the gt555m in the alienware

EDIT: not to mention comparing a ULV i7 to an atom… There is no comparison

Read full topic

item.title: netbook
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
russilker:

Hate to suggest this, but alienware has the m11x “netbook” with g555m graphics IIRC. I put netbook in quotes because while it does have an 11" screen, it’s a lot thicker and heavier than most netbooks. Overpriced as are all alienwares, but it’s the only “gaming” netbook I know of, unfortunately

wheybags:

Hp mini 311
Got mine for 200 EURO IIRC, [COLOR=‘Red’]can play new vegas no problem.
Pretty tiny too.

Read full topic
